exam.question: It is very strange but I had an ______ that the plane would crash.

answer.explain: 句意： 很奇怪， 我当时就有种直觉， 觉得飞机会失事。inspiration： 灵感； imagination： 想象力； incentive： 动机。

exam.question: His ______ was telling him that something was wrong.

answer.explain: 句意： 直觉告诉他出事了。 hypothesis： 假设； sentiment： 情操， 情感。

sentences.sContent: Intuition told her it was unwise to argue.
sentences.sCn: 直觉告诉她争吵是不理智的。

sentences.sContent: ...I'm hoping to get a better grip on some of the questions raised by the data revolution: In what situations should we rely on intuitive pattern recognition and in which situations should we ignore intuition and follow the data...

synos.tran: [心理]直觉；直觉力；直觉的知识

remMethod.val: in ＋ tuition(学费) → 凡事只凭直觉， 终究要为此交“学费”的 → 直觉

trans.tranCn: 直觉； 由直觉获知的信息
trans.tranOther: the ability to understand or know something because of a feeling rather than by considering the facts
